acceptedAnswer.text: The professional discipline of environmental engineering is defined as the application of engineering principles to improve and maintain the environment for the protection of human health, for the protection of nature’s beneficial ecosystems, and for environment-related enhancement of the quality of human life.

The professional discipline of environmental science is defined as the application of scientific principles to improve and maintain the environment for the protection of human health for the protection of nature’s beneficial ecosystems, and environment-related enhancement of the quality of human life.

@graph.name: American Academy of Environmental Engineers and Scientists (AAEES)

hasCredential.name: Board Certified Environmental Engineer (BCEE)
hasCredential.description: The premier board certification for licensed professional engineers in the environmental field.

hasCredential.name: Board Certified Environmental Scientist (BCES)
hasCredential.description: Advanced professional certification for environmental scientists demonstrating high-level competence and expertise.
